subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-lap||leaf}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|ལོ་མ||leaf}}, Western {{cog|bo|ལོབ་མ||leaf}}. Related to {{och-l|世|world}}.

This is part of the word family *''lVp'' meaning “flat”, represented by the phonetic component {{och-l|枼}}. Compare also {{och-l|茶|tea < *leaf}}.

Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Leaf}} [[File:Leavessnipedale.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|葉}} (''ha'', ''yō''): sunlight through '''[[leaf|leaves]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|は}} {{IPAchar|/pa/}} → {{IPAchar|/fa/}} → {{IPAchar|/ha/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=は|-}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}, from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*pa}}. Probably distinct from the {{etyl|ojp|-}} verb {{m|ja|生ゆ|tr=hayu||to sprout, to grow}} → modern {{m|ja|生える|tr=haeru}} and {{m|ja|花|tr=hana||flower}} and instead related to {{m|ja|羽|tr=ha||feather; wing}}. Probably also cognate with {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha||tooth}} from the way that both sprout and then later fall, and with {{m|ja|刃|tr=ha||blade}} from similarities in shape. Compare {{cog|en|blade}}.
